definition: to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
see 改換門庭|改换门庭[gai3 huan4 men2 ting2]

sentences.english: Third, the joint reading of Jones writing changed, but so.
sentences.chinese: 第三，聯讀悟寫，改換門庭。

sentences.english: The goal that was named cannot be countermanded.
sentences.chinese: 已經認定了的目標不能再改換。

sentences.english: On the base that plays sanded bag in adroitness control, let a student change bump handball.
sentences.chinese: 在熟練掌握踢沙包的基礎上，讓學生改換顛手球。

sentences.english: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind;
sentences.chinese: 又要將你們的心志改換一新。

sentences.english: Bingo, he or she changes spousal brands.
sentences.chinese: 對的，然後她改換了和自己結婚的品牌。

sentences.english: Users are simply satisfied with the search results they are getting right now and don't see the need to switch.
sentences.chinese: 用戶對搜索結果十分滿意，覺得沒有改換門庭的必要。

sentences.english: This company changes after half an year door front courtyard lands American OTCBB market.
sentences.chinese: 半年後該公司改換門庭並登陸美國OTCBB市場。

sentences.english: They changed their dwellings from time to time.
And it seems restaurants don't necessarily need to change their menus anytime soon.
sentences.chinese: 但是目前看來餐館還不必要立即改換它們的菜單。

sentences.english: Hip-pop culture will not stop when time cha strongge.
sentences.chinese: 嘻哈文明永遠不會由於時間而停止改換。

sentences.english: One woman said, "Asking me to change my diet is like asking me to change my children."
sentences.chinese: 一位婦女說，“叫我改換飲食就像叫我換孩子。”

sentences.english: Then the prophet went and stood by the road waiting for the king. He disguised himself with his headband down over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他就去了，用頭巾矇眼，改換面目，在路旁等候王。

sentences.english: Quick lime powder should be timely change.
sentences.chinese: 生石灰變粉應及時改換。

sentences.english: Many, however, linger only in a metamorphosed or disguised form.
sentences.chinese: 不過風俗猶存，但許多已經改換了形式，加上了僞裝。

sentences.english: Why change to Australian Oaten Hay?
sentences.chinese: 爲何改換成澳大利亞燕麥乾草？

sentences.english: May I change to a stateroom with an ocean view?
sentences.chinese: 請問可以改換有海景窗戶的艙房嗎？

definition: to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to make a catalogue/catalogue/list
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
difference/discrepancy
famous school/noted school of thought
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
paradigm
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
small-scale/local/to a limited extent
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
retort with challenging questions/debate
to inquire into/to ask after
